Reactive mixtures of hydrides have been proposed as a way to tailor the dehydrogenation
temperature or improve rehydrogenation in borohydrides [
more) hydrides (simple or complex) are mixed; and, under suitable dehydrogenation conditions, they
react with each other. The dehydrogenation is modiﬁed, including the dehydrogenation pathway,
temperature, kinetics, and reversibility. Notably, the dehydrogenation temperature of composites is
sensitive to the way of mixing of materials and the history of the composite; i.e., time and conditions
of mixing, purity of reagents, cycling, etc. In the past decade, the research on LiAlH
